												<b class="fn">Spend With Pennies AO</b> <span class="says">says:</span>					</div><!-- .comment-author -->

					<div class="comment-metadata">
						<a href="https://www.spendwithpennies.com/apple-pie-recipe/comment-page-2/#comment-422789"><time datetime="2022-11-29T09:29:55-08:00">November 29, 2022 at 9:29 am</time></a>					</div><!-- .comment-metadata -->

									</footer><!-- .comment-meta -->

				<div class="comment-content">
					<p>Oh no! I am sorry to hear that Sandi. Did you make sure your apples were sliced thin enough? I slice them between 1/4″-1/8″ thick. If it needed to be baked a little further but the crust was getting too brown, you could cover the edges with foil or a pie crust shield. I hope this helps!</p>
				</div><!-- .comment-content -->

				<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-422789' data-commentid="422789" data-postid="139979" data-belowelement="div-comment-422789" data-respondelement="respond" data-replyto="Reply to Spend With Pennies AO" aria-label='Reply to Spend With Pennies AO'>Reply</a></div>			</article><!-- .comment-body -->
		<ol class="children">
		<li id="comment-432137" class="comment even depth-3">
			<article id="div-comment-432137" class="comment-body">
				<footer class="comment-meta">
					<div class="comment-author vcard">
												<b class="fn">Julia Truelove</b> <span class="says">says:</span>					</div><!-- .comment-author -->

					<div class="comment-metadata">
						<a href="https://www.spendwithpennies.com/apple-pie-recipe/comment-page-2/#comment-432137"><time datetime="2023-05-23T20:02:13-07:00">May 23, 2023 at 8:02 pm</time></a>					</div><!-- .comment-metadata -->

									</footer><!-- .comment-meta -->

				<div class="comment-content">
					<p>Yes, exactly! Same thing happened to me. I did not slice the apples 1/8″ and that was why the pie crust cooked and all but the apples were crunchy. I would not recommend dicing apples for the same reason. But I learned what went wrong and make sure they are sliced thin. I like a little extra spice so put in a sprinkling of ground clove. Added a touch more cinnamon to mine as well. And I also used both Granny Smith and Pink Lady apples. I used 1/4 C. white sugar and 1/4 C. densly packed dark brown sugar. Just my preference.  Great recipe. Marie Callendar’s frozen crust as well.<img class="wprm-comment-rating" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODdhAQABAPAAAP///wAAACwAAAAAAQABAEACAkQBADs=" data-lazy-src="https://www.spendwithpennies.com/wp-content/plugins/wp-recipe-maker/assets/icons/rating/stars-5.svg" alt="5 stars" width="80" height="16" /></p>
				</div><!-- .comment-content -->

							</article><!-- .comment-body -->
		</li><!-- #comment-## -->
</ol><!-- .children -->
</li><!-- #comment-## -->
</ol><!-- .children -->
</li><!-- #comment-## -->
		<li id="comment-422432" class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1">
			<article id="div-comment-422432" class="comment-body">
				<footer class="comment-meta">
					<div class="comment-author vcard">
												<b class="fn">Courtney</b> <span class="says">says:</span>					</div><!-- .comment-author -->

					<div class="comment-metadata">
						<a href="https://www.spendwithpennies.com/apple-pie-recipe/comment-page-2/#comment-422432"><time datetime="2022-11-24T09:05:06-08:00">November 24, 2022 at 9:05 am</time></a>					</div><!-- .comment-metadata -->

									</footer><!-- .comment-meta -->

				<div class="comment-content">
					<p>very delicious!!<img class="wprm-comment-rating" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODdhAQABAPAAAP///wAAACwAAAAAAQABAEACAkQBADs=" data-lazy-src="https://www.spendwithpennies.com/wp-content/plugins/wp-recipe-maker/assets/icons/rating/stars-5.svg" alt="5 stars" width="80" height="16" /></p>
				</div><!-- .comment-content -->

				<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-422432' data-commentid="422432" data-postid="139979" data-belowelement="div-comment-422432" data-respondelement="respond" data-replyto="Reply to Courtney" aria-label='Reply to Courtney'>Reply</a></div>			</article><!-- .comment-body -->
		</li><!-- #comment-## -->
		<li id="comment-422021" class="comment even thread-even depth-1">
			<article id="div-comment-422021" class="comment-body">
				<footer class="comment-meta">
					<div class="comment-author vcard">
												<b class="fn">Tammy George</b> <span class="says">says:</span>					</div><!-- .comment-author -->

					<div class="comment-metadata">
						<a href="https://www.spendwithpennies.com/apple-pie-recipe/comment-page-2/#comment-422021"><time datetime="2022-11-20T10:05:02-08:00">November 20, 2022 at 10:05 am</time></a>					</div><!-- .comment-metadata -->

									</footer><!-- .comment-meta -->

				<div class="comment-content">
					<p>Easy peasy thanks<img class="wprm-comment-rating" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODdhAQABAPAAAP///wAAACwAAAAAAQABAEACAkQBADs=" data-lazy-src="https://www.spendwithpennies.com/wp-content/plugins/wp-recipe-maker/assets/icons/rating/stars-4.svg" alt="4 stars" width="80" height="16" /></p>
				</div><!-- .comment-content -->

				<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-422021' data-commentid="422021" data-postid="139979" data-belowelement="div-comment-422021" data-respondelement="respond" data-replyto="Reply to Tammy George" aria-label='Reply to Tammy George'>Reply</a></div>			</article><!-- .comment-body -->
		</li><!-- #comment-## -->
		<li id="comment-421687" class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1 parent">
			<article id="div-comment-421687" class="comment-body">
				<footer class="comment-meta">
					<div class="comment-author vcard">
												<b class="fn">Barb A. J.</b> <span class="says">says:</span>					</div><!-- .comment-author -->

					<div class="comment-metadata">
						<a href="https://www.spendwithpennies.com/apple-pie-recipe/comment-page-2/#comment-421687"><time datetime="2022-11-15T19:18:41-08:00">November 15, 2022 at 7:18 pm</time></a>					</div><!-- .comment-metadata -->

									</footer><!-- .comment-meta -->

				<div class="comment-content">
					<p>Question :   I want to make this, but want to freeze it for Thanksgiving 2022. Should I cut slits in top crust, do egg wash and sugar before freezing so it will be completely ready to bake from frozen ? I’ve never made an Apple Pie before, but it’s my families favorite. Please help me to please my family. Thanks !!!</p>
				</div><!-- .comment-content -->

				<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-421687' data-commentid="421687" data-postid="139979" data-belowelement="div-comment-421687" data-respondelement="respond" data-replyto="Reply to Barb A. J." aria-label='Reply to Barb A. J.'>Reply</a></div>			</article><!-- .comment-body -->
		<ol class="children">
		<li id="comment-421892" class="comment byuser comment-author-spend-with-pennies-ao even depth-2 staff">
			<article id="div-comment-421892" class="comment-body">
				<footer class="comment-meta">
					<div class="comment-author vcard">
												<b class="fn">Spend With Pennies AO</b> <span class="says">says:</span>					</div><!-- .comment-author -->

					<div class="comment-metadata">
						<a href="https://www.spendwithpennies.com/apple-pie-recipe/comment-page-2/#comment-421892"><time datetime="2022-11-18T09:18:46-08:00">November 18, 2022 at 9:18 am</time></a>					</div><!-- .comment-metadata -->

									</footer><!-- .comment-meta -->

				<div class="comment-content">
					<p>Hi Barb, this pie freezes well. I would fully prepare then freeze the pie. To bake from frozen, preheat the oven to 425°F.  Place the pie on a rimmed baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes. Decrease the heat to 375°F and bake an additional 40-55 minutes or until the crust is golden and the apples are softened. If the top begins to brown too much, loosely cover it with foil.</p>
				</div><!-- .comment-content -->

				<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-421892' data-commentid="421892" data-postid="139979" data-belowelement="div-comment-421892" data-respondelement="respond" data-replyto="Reply to Spend With Pennies AO" aria-label='Reply to Spend With Pennies AO'>Reply</a></div>			</article><!-- .comment-body -->
		</li><!-- #comment-## -->
</ol><!-- .children -->
</li><!-- #comment-## -->
		<li id="comment-419884" class="comment odd alt thread-even depth-1 parent">
			<article id="div-comment-419884" class="comment-body">
				<footer class="comment-meta">
					<div class="comment-author vcard">
												<b class="fn">Dianne Richardson</b> <span class="says">says:</span>					</div><!-- .comment-author -->

					<div class="comment-metadata">
						<a href="https://www.spendwithpennies.com/apple-pie-recipe/comment-page-2/#comment-419884"><time datetime="2022-10-17T08:57:31-07:00">October 17, 2022 at 8:57 am</time></a>					</div><!-- .comment-metadata -->

									</footer><!-- .comment-meta -->

				<div class="comment-content">
					<p>my recipe is similar to this.  the problem I have been having is the bottom crust does not cook. what could I be doing wrong.  I use the same cook time as is in the recipe.</p>
				</div><!-- .comment-content -->

				<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-419884' data-commentid="419884" data-postid="139979" data-belowelement="div-comment-419884" data-respondelement="respond" data-replyto="Reply to Dianne Richardson" aria-label='Reply to Dianne Richardson'>Reply</a></div>			</article><!-- .comment-body -->
		<ol class="children">
		<li id="comment-419888" class="comment byuser comment-author-spend-with-pennies-ao even depth-2 staff">
			<article id="div-comment-419888" class="comment-body">
				<footer class="comment-meta">
					<div class="comment-author vcard">
												<b class="fn">Spend With Pennies AO</b> <span class="says">says:</span>					</div><!-- .comment-author -->

					<div class="comment-metadata">
						<a href="https://www.spendwithpennies.com/apple-pie-recipe/comment-page-2/#comment-419888"><time datetime="2022-10-17T09:09:02-07:00">October 17, 2022 at 9:09 am</time></a>					</div><!-- .comment-metadata -->

									</footer><!-- .comment-meta -->

				<div class="comment-content">
					<p>Do you also do a two-temp baking Dianne? I start at 425°F and then reduce to 375°F. Additionally, are you using a lattice crust or whole top crust? If you’re using a whole top crust are you cutting in enough slits to allow the steam to escape properly?</p>
				</div><!-- .comment-content -->

				<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-419888' data-commentid="419888" data-postid="139979" data-belowelement="div-comment-419888" data-respondelement="respond" data-replyto="Reply to Spend With Pennies AO" aria-label='Reply to Spend With Pennies AO'>Reply</a></div>			</article><!-- .comment-body -->
		</li><!-- #comment-## -->
</ol><!-- .children -->
</li><!-- #comment-## -->
		<li id="comment-419063" class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1">
			<article id="div-comment-419063" class="comment-body">
				<footer class="comment-meta">
					<div class="comment-author vcard">
												<b class="fn">S</b> <span class="says">says:</span>					</div><!-- .comment-author -->

					<div class="comment-metadata">
						<a href="https://www.spendwithpennies.com/apple-pie-recipe/comment-page-2/#comment-419063"><time datetime="2022-10-01T19:05:23-07:00">October 1, 2022 at 7:05 pm</time></a>					</div><!-- .comment-metadata -->

									</footer><!-- .comment-meta -->

				<div class="comment-content">
					<p>This recipe was perfect! Not too sweet and worked with store bought pillsbury crust. Used Macintosh and was great. Thank you!<img class="wprm-comment-rating" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODdhAQABAPAAAP///wAAACwAAAAAAQABAEACAkQBADs=" data-lazy-src="https://www.spendwithpennies.com/wp-content/plugins/wp-recipe-maker/assets/icons/rating/stars-5.svg" alt="5 stars" width="80" height="16" /></p>
				</div><!-- .comment-content -->

				<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-419063' data-commentid="419063" data-postid="139979" data-belowelement="div-comment-419063" data-respondelement="respond" data-replyto="Reply to S" aria-label='Reply to S'>Reply</a></div>			</article><!-- .comment-body -->
		</li><!-- #comment-## -->
		<li id="comment-418690" class="comment even thread-even depth-1">
			<article id="div-comment-418690" class="comment-body">
				<footer class="comment-meta">
					<div class="comment-author vcard">
												<b class="fn">Deb M</b> <span class="says">says:</span>					</div><!-- .comment-author -->

					<div class="comment-metadata">
						<a href="https://www.spendwithpennies.com/apple-pie-recipe/comment-page-2/#comment-418690"><time datetime="2022-09-25T12:29:09-07:00">September 25, 2022 at 12:29 pm</time></a>					</div><!-- .comment-metadata -->

									</footer><!-- .comment-meta -->

				<div class="comment-content">
					<p>Great recipe, thanks for sharing it. :)<img class="wprm-comment-rating" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODdhAQABAPAAAP///wAAACwAAAAAAQABAEACAkQBADs=" data-lazy-src="https://www.spendwithpennies.com/wp-content/plugins/wp-recipe-maker/assets/icons/rating/stars-5.svg" alt="5 stars" width="80" height="16" /></p>
				</div><!-- .comment-content -->

				<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-418690' data-commentid="418690" data-postid="139979" data-belowelement="div-comment-418690" data-respondelement="respond" data-replyto="Reply to Deb M" aria-label='Reply to Deb M'>Reply</a></div>			</article><!-- .comment-body -->
		</li><!-- #comment-## -->
		<li id="comment-415438" class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1 parent">
			<article id="div-comment-415438" class="comment-body">
				<footer class="comment-meta">
					<div class="comment-author vcard">
												<b class="fn">Elizabeth</b> <span class="says">says:</span>					</div><!-- .comment-author -->

					<div class="comment-metadata">
						<a href="https://www.spendwithpennies.com/apple-pie-recipe/comment-page-2/#comment-415438"><time datetime="2022-07-23T07:11:59-07:00">July 23, 2022 at 7:11 am</time></a>					</div><!-- .comment-metadata -->

									</footer><!-- .comment-meta -->

				<div class="comment-content">
					<p>Hello Holly, LOVE your recipes! Quick question: How would your pre-made recipe for Apple Pie filling be used in this recipe as opposed to uncooked apples? Thanks in advance!<img class="wprm-comment-rating" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODdhAQABAPAAAP///wAAACwAAAAAAQABAEACAkQBADs=" data-lazy-src="https://www.spendwithpennies.com/wp-content/plugins/wp-recipe-maker/assets/icons/rating/stars-5.svg" alt="5 stars" width="80" height="16" /></p>
				</div><!-- .comment-content -->

				<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-415438' data-commentid="415438" data-postid="139979" data-belowelement="div-comment-415438" data-respondelement="respond" data-replyto="Reply to Elizabeth" aria-label='Reply to Elizabeth'>Reply</a></div>			</article><!-- .comment-body -->
		<ol class="children">
		<li id="comment-417492" class="comment byuser comment-author-spend-with-pennies-ao even depth-2 staff">
			<article id="div-comment-417492" class="comment-body">
				<footer class="comment-meta">
					<div class="comment-author vcard">
												<b class="fn">Spend With Pennies AO</b> <span class="says">says:</span>					</div><!-- .comment-author -->

					<div class="comment-metadata">
						<a href="https://www.spendwithpennies.com/apple-pie-recipe/comment-page-2/#comment-417492"><time datetime="2022-09-02T12:12:05-07:00">September 2, 2022 at 12:12 pm</time></a>					</div><!-- .comment-metadata -->

									</footer><!-- .comment-meta -->

				<div class="comment-content">
					<p>Hi Elizabeth! I would suggest baking at 425°F for 35-45 minutes or until the crust has browned. Enjoy!</p>
				</div><!-- .comment-content -->

				<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-417492' data-commentid="417492" data-postid="139979" data-belowelement="div-comment-417492" data-respondelement="respond" data-replyto="Reply to Spend With Pennies AO" aria-label='Reply to Spend With Pennies AO'>Reply</a></div>			</article><!-- .comment-body -->
		</li><!-- #comment-## -->
</ol><!-- .children -->
</li><!-- #comment-## -->
		<li id="comment-411471" class="comment odd alt thread-even depth-1">
			<article id="div-comment-411471" class="comment-body">
				<footer class="comment-meta">
					<div class="comment-author vcard">
												<b class="fn">Susmita</b> <span class="says">says:</span>					</div><!-- .comment-author -->

					<div class="comment-metadata">
						<a href="https://www.spendwithpennies.com/apple-pie-recipe/comment-page-2/#comment-411471"><time datetime="2022-04-19T07:51:57-07:00">April 19, 2022 at 7:51 am</time></a>					</div><!-- .comment-metadata -->

									</footer><!-- .comment-meta -->

				<div class="comment-content">
					<p>Nice recipe!<img class="wprm-comment-rating" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODdhAQABAPAAAP///wAAACwAAAAAAQABAEACAkQBADs=" data-lazy-src="https://www.spendwithpennies.com/wp-content/plugins/wp-recipe-maker/assets/icons/rating/stars-5.svg" alt="5 stars" width="80" height="16" /></p>
				</div><!-- .comment-content -->

				<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-411471' data-commentid="411471" data-postid="139979" data-belowelement="div-comment-411471" data-respondelement="respond" data-replyto="Reply to Susmita" aria-label='Reply to Susmita'>Reply</a></div>			</article><!-- .comment-body -->
		</li><!-- #comment-## -->
		<li id="comment-411399" class="comment even thread-odd thread-alt depth-1">
			<article id="div-comment-411399" class="comment-body">
				<footer class="comment-meta">
					<div class="comment-author vcard">
												<b class="fn">J.curtis</b> <span class="says">says:</span>					</div><!-- .comment-author -->

					<div class="comment-metadata">
						<a href="https://www.spendwithpennies.com/apple-pie-recipe/comment-page-2/#comment-411399"><time datetime="2022-04-17T11:17:36-07:00">April 17, 2022 at 11:17 am</time></a>					</div><!-- .comment-metadata -->

									</footer><!-- .comment-meta -->

				<div class="comment-content">
					<p>Perfect. Went exactly by the recipe and it turned out so good, thank you.<img class="wprm-comment-rating" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODdhAQABAPAAAP///wAAACwAAAAAAQABAEACAkQBADs=" data-lazy-src="https://www.spendwithpennies.com/wp-content/plugins/wp-recipe-maker/assets/icons/rating/stars-5.svg" alt="5 stars" width="80" height="16" /></p>
				</div><!-- .comment-content -->

				<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-411399' data-commentid="411399" data-postid="139979" data-belowelement="div-comment-411399" data-respondelement="respond" data-replyto="Reply to J.curtis" aria-label='Reply to J.curtis'>Reply</a></div>			</article><!-- .comment-body -->
		</li><!-- #comment-## -->
		<li id="comment-406071" class="comment odd alt thread-even depth-1 parent">
			<article id="div-comment-406071" class="comment-body">
				<footer class="comment-meta">
					<div class="comment-author vcard">
												<b class="fn">Jenny Laforet</b> <span class="says">says:</span>					</div><!-- .comment-author -->

					<div class="comment-metadata">
						<a href="https://www.spendwithpennies.com/apple-pie-recipe/comment-page-2/#comment-406071"><time datetime="2021-12-27T22:13:54-08:00">December 27, 2021 at 10:13 pm</time></a>					</div><!-- .comment-metadata -->

									</footer><!-- .comment-meta -->

				<div class="comment-content">
					<p>My go-to classic apple pie recipe. Very simple to make and less sugar than other recipes so apple flavor can take center stage, as it should! Apple pie is my husband’s favorite and he loves this version!<img class="wprm-comment-rating" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODdhAQABAPAAAP///wAAACwAAAAAAQABAEACAkQBADs=" data-lazy-src="https://www.spendwithpennies.com/wp-content/plugins/wp-recipe-maker/assets/icons/rating/stars-5.svg" alt="5 stars" width="80" height="16" /></p>
				</div><!-- .comment-content -->

				<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-406071' data-commentid="406071" data-postid="139979" data-belowelement="div-comment-406071" data-respondelement="respond" data-replyto="Reply to Jenny Laforet" aria-label='Reply to Jenny Laforet'>Reply</a></div>			</article><!-- .comment-body -->
		<ol class="children">
		<li id="comment-410751" class="comment even depth-2 parent">
			<article id="div-comment-410751" class="comment-body">
				<footer class="comment-meta">
					<div class="comment-author vcard">
												<b class="fn">T.C.</b> <span class="says">says:</span>					</div><!-- .comment-author -->

					<div class="comment-metadata">
						<a href="https://www.spendwithpennies.com/apple-pie-recipe/comment-page-2/#comment-410751"><time datetime="2022-04-02T07:06:05-07:00">April 2, 2022 at 7:06 am</time></a>					</div><!-- .comment-metadata -->

									</footer><!-- .comment-meta -->

				<div class="comment-content">
					<p>I would love to try this recipe. What kind of apples did you use?</p>
				</div><!-- .comment-content -->

				<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-410751' data-commentid="410751" data-postid="139979" data-belowelement="div-comment-410751" data-respondelement="respond" data-replyto="Reply to T.C." aria-label='Reply to T.C.'>Reply</a></div>			</article><!-- .comment-body -->
		<ol class="children">
		<li id="comment-410840" class="comment byuser comment-author-spend-with-pennies-ch odd alt depth-3 staff">
			<article id="div-comment-410840" class="comment-body">
				<footer class="comment-meta">
					<div class="comment-author vcard">
												<b class="fn">Spend With Pennies CH</b> <span class="says">says:</span>					</div><!-- .comment-author -->

					<div class="comment-metadata">
						<a href="https://www.spendwithpennies.com/apple-pie-recipe/comment-page-2/#comment-410840"><time datetime="2022-04-04T13:40:26-07:00">April 4, 2022 at 1:40 pm</time></a>					</div><!-- .comment-metadata -->

									</footer><!-- .comment-meta -->

				<div class="comment-content">
					<p>Hi TC, you’ll find information about the best apples to use in the post in the section The Best Apples for Pie. My personal favorite is Granny Smith. Enjoy the pie!</p>
				</div><!-- .comment-content -->

							</article><!-- .comment-body -->
		</li><!-- #comment-## -->
</ol><!-- .children -->
</li><!-- #comment-## -->
</ol><!-- .children -->

0 0 1 6.91-.785Z" /></symbol></defs></svg><style type="text/css">.wprm-recipe {
	background: #fafafa;
	padding: 0 16px;
}

.wprm-recipe li {
	font-size: inherit;
}

.wprm-recipe-image {
	position: relative;
	margin-bottom: 16px;
}

.wprm-recipe-image img {
	position: relative;
	z-index: 2;
}

.wprm-recipe-image::before {
	content: '';
	display: block;
	width: calc( 100% + 32px );
	height: 50%;
	top: 0;
	left: -16px;
	background: #fff;
	position: absolute;
}

.wprm-recipe-rating {
	color: var(--wp--preset--color--primary);
	text-align: center;
	margin-bottom: 16px;
}

.wprm-rating-cta {
	margin-left: 8px;
}


.wprm-recipe-rating .wprm-rating-star {
	zoom: 2;
}

.wprm-recipe-icon img {
	width: 24px;
	height: 24px;
	filter: invert(23%) sepia(55%) saturate(731%) hue-rotate(283deg) brightness(94%) contrast(92%);
}

.wprm-block-text-bold {
	font-weight: 900 !important;
}

.wprm-recipe-details-unit {
	font-size: inherit;
}

.wprm-recipe .wprm-recipe-header,
.wprm-recipe .wprm-recipe-group-name {
	line-height: var(--wp--custom--line-height--small);
}

.wprm-recipe-name {
	text-align: center;
}

.wprm-recipe-summary {
	margin: 16px 0;
	text-align: center;
}

.wprm-action-items {
	display: flex;
	justify-content: center;
	margin-bottom: 16px;
}

.wprm-action-items a {
	background: var(--wp--preset--color--primary);
	border-radius: var(--wp--custom--border-radius--tiny);
	color: var(--wp--preset--color--white);
	font-weight: 600;
	font-size: var(--wp--preset--font-size--medium);
	line-height: var(--wp--custom--line-height--small);
	padding: 10px;
	margin: 0 6px;
	text-decoration: none;
}

.wprm-action-items a:hover {
	background: var(--wp--custom--color--primary-darken);
}

.wprm-action-items svg {
	display: none;
}

.wprm-details {
	border-bottom: 1px solid #e0e0e0;
	padding: 16px 0 16px 40px;
	position: relative;
	font-size: var(--wp--preset--font-size--small);
}

.wprm-action-items + .wprm-details {
	border-top: 1px solid #e0e0e0;
}

.wprm-recipe-details-label {
	font-weight: 700;
	margin-right: 8px;
	display: inline-block;
	min-width: 80px;
}

.wprm-details .wprm-icon-shortcode {
	position: absolute;
	top: 16px;
	left: 0;
}

.wprm-recipe-equipment-container,
.wprm-recipe-ingredients-container,
.wprm-recipe-instructions-container,
.wprm-recipe-video-container,
.wprm-recipe-notes-container {
	margin: 16px 0;
	border-bottom: 1px solid #e0e0e0;
	padding-bottom: 16px;
}

.wprm-recipe-equipment-image {
	background: #fff;
	border-radius: var(--wp--custom--border-radius--tiny);
	box-shadow: var(--wp--custom--box-shadow--1);
	min-height: 233px;
	display: flex;
	align-items: center;
	justify-content: center;
	margin-bottom: 8px;
	overflow: hidden;
}

.wprm-recipe-equipment-name {
	font-size: var(--wp--preset--font-size--tiny);
}

.wprm-recipe-equipment-images .wprm-recipe-equipment-item {
	margin: 0;
}

.wprm-toggle-container button.wprm-toggle,
.wprm-toggle-container button.wprm-toggle:not(.wprm-toggle-active) {
	color: #fff !important;
	border: none !important;
	border-radius: var(--wp--custom--border-radius--tiny);
	margin-left: 8px;
	font-weight: 600 !important;
	cursor: pointer;
}

.wprm-toggle-container button.wprm-toggle:not(.wprm-toggle-active) {
	background: var(--wp--preset--color--foreground) !important;
}

.wprm-recipe-adjustable-servings-container {
	background: transparent !important;
	border: none !important;
}

.wprm-recipe-header.wprm-header-has-actions {
	justify-content: space-between;
}

.wprm-recipe-container .wprm-recipe ul {
	padding: 0;
}

.wprm-recipe-equipment li .wprm-checkbox-container,
.wprm-recipe-ingredients li .wprm-checkbox-container,
.wprm-recipe-instructions li .wprm-checkbox-container {
	top: 12px;
}

.wprm-recipe .wprm-recipe-instruction-group,
.wprm-recipe .wprm-recipe-ingredients {
	margin-top: 16px;
}

.wprm-recipe-instructions {
	counter-reset: li;
}

.wprm-recipe-instructions li {
	list-style-type: none !important;
	margin-left: 0;
	padding-left: 29px;
}

.wprm-recipe-instructions li::before {
	background: var(--wp--preset--color--primary);
	color: #fff;
	font-size: 12px;
	font-weight: 600;
	content: counter(li);
	counter-increment: li;
	width: 21px;
	height: 21px;
	border-radius: 50%;
	display: flex;
	align-items: center;
	justify-content: center;
	position: absolute;
	top: 7px;
	left: 0;
}

.wprm-recipe-notes ul li {
	list-style-type: none;
	margin-left: 0;
}

.wprm-recipe-notes ul li::before {
	color: var(--wp--preset--color--primary);
	content: '❥';
	display: inline-block;
	margin-right: 8px;
}

h3.wprm-recipe-nutrition-header {
	font-size: var(--wp--preset--font-size--large);
}

.wprm-nutrition-label-container {
	font-size: var(--wp--preset--font-size--small);
}

.wprm-nutrition-label-text-nutrition-label.wprm-block-text-faded {
	opacity: 1;
}

.wprm-nutrition-label-container-simple .wprm-nutrition-label-text-nutrition-unit {
	font-size: inherit;
}

.wprm-recipe p.nutrition-note,
.wprm-recipe p.wprm-copyright {
	margin: 16px 0;
	font-size: var(--wp--preset--font-size--small);
}

.wprm-terms {
	border-top: 1px solid #e0e0e0;
	font-size: var(--wp--preset--font-size--small);
	margin: 16px 0;
}

.wprm-terms .wprm-recipe-meta-container {
	border-bottom: 1px solid #e0e0e0;
	padding: 16px 0 16px 40px;
	position: relative;
}

.wprm-terms .wprm-recipe-icon {
	position: absolute;
	top: 16px;
	left: 0;
}

@media only screen and (max-width: 767px) {
	.wprm-recipe {
		margin-left: calc( -1 * var(--wp--custom--layout--padding) );
		margin-right: calc( -1 * var(--wp--custom--layout--padding ) );
	}

	.wprm-recipe-equipment-image {
		min-height: 0;
	}

	.wprm-recipe .wprm-recipe-equipment-images {
		display: grid;
		grid-auto-flow: column;
		grid-auto-columns: 233px;
		grid-column-gap: 21px;
		overflow-x: auto;
		padding-bottom: 16px;
	}
}

@media only screen and (max-width: 400px) {
	.wprm-recipe-equipment-grid .wprm-recipe-equipment-grid-row	{
		display: flex;
	}
}

@media only screen and (min-width: 768px) {
	.wprm-recipe {
		padding: 0 32px;
	}

	.wprm-recipe-image::before {
		left: -32px;
		width: calc( 100% + 64px );
	}

	.wprm-details .wprm-recipe-meta-container {
		display: flex;
		flex-wrap: wrap;
		justify-content: space-between;
	}

	.wprm-details .wprm-recipe-meta-container > *:nth-child(4) {
		flex-basis: 100%;
	}

	.wprm-recipe .wprm-recipe-equipment-images {
		display: grid;
		grid-template-columns: repeat( 3, 1fr );
		grid-gap: 16px;
	}
}

You just need to cook clever and get creative!","sameAs":["http://www.recipetineats.com/about-me/"]},{"@type":"Recipe","name":"My Perfect Apple Pie","author":{"@id":"https://www.recipetineats.com/#/schema/person/1d495a057e0419b552333c8526d827a9"},"description":"Recipe video above. Basic Apple Pie recipes just call for piling raw apples in an uncooked pie crust. It will work ... but the crust will have raw patches, be soggy, the apples unevenly cooked and you'll have a giant empty cavity under the pie lid. Hmm.If, like me, that's not good enough for you, make my Perfect Apple Pie! The trick: bake the apples for the filling first and blind bake your crust. Result? Superior flavour, perfectly cooked apple filling, a crispy base and no unsightly gaping cave under your pie lid!NOTE: Saddened to see mixed reviews where the wrong apple types has been used. This recipe is made for Granny Smith Apples! Other apples are not juicy enough or too soft. Use paper excess to remove beads into a bowl. Brush base and sides (not rim) lightly with whisked egg. Return crust to oven for 5 minutes.","url":"https://www.recipetineats.com/apple-pie-recipe/#wprm-recipe-77185-step-0-6"},{"@type":"HowToStep","text":"Cool: Crust should be light golden and look fully cooked. Cool 15 minutes before filling.","name":"Cool: Crust should be light golden and look fully cooked. Cool 15 minutes before filling.","url":"https://www.recipetineats.com/apple-pie-recipe/#wprm-recipe-77185-step-0-7"}]},{"@type":"HowToSection","name":"Lattice (Note 6 for full lid):","itemListElement":[{"@type":"HowToStep","text":"Remove remaining dough from fridge 30 minutes prior. Roll out to 3 mm / 1/8" thick and cut into 12 x  2.5cm/1" strips. Transfer to board, cover with cling wrap and refrigerate until required.","name":"Remove remaining dough from fridge 30 minutes prior. Roll out to 3 mm / 1/8" thick and cut into 12 x  2.5cm/1" strips. Transfer to board, cover with cling wrap and refrigerate until required.","url":"https://www.recipetineats.com/apple-pie-recipe/#wprm-recipe-77185-step-1-0"}]},{"@type":"HowToSection","name":"Apple Pie Filling:","itemListElement":[{"@type":"HowToStep","text":"Preheat oven to 180°C / 350°F (160°C fan).","name":"Preheat oven to 180°C / 350°F (160°C fan).","url":"https://www.recipetineats.com/apple-pie-recipe/#wprm-recipe-77185-step-2-0"},{"@type":"HowToStep","text":"Spice mix: Mix the sugar, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg and salt in a bowl.","name":"Spice mix: Mix the sugar, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg and salt in a bowl.","url":"https://www.recipetineats.com/apple-pie-recipe/#wprm-recipe-77185-step-2-1"},{"@type":"HowToStep","text":"Toss: In a large bowl, sprinkle spice mix over apple slices. Toss well with hands, separating pieces that are stuck together.","url":"https://www.recipetineats.com/apple-pie-recipe/#wprm-recipe-77185-step-2-2"},{"@type":"HowToStep","text":"Bake: Spread across 2 large trays. Bake until soft but still holding form - check first at 15 min, and every 5 mins thereafter (mine take 40 min - Note 7). Do not stir or rotate trays.","name":"Bake: Spread across 2 large trays. Bake until soft but still holding form - check first at 15 min, and every 5 mins thereafter (mine take 40 min - Note 7). Do not stir or rotate trays.","url":"https://www.recipetineats.com/apple-pie-recipe/#wprm-recipe-77185-step-2-3"},{"@type":"HowToStep","text":"Drain off juices: Remove trays from oven. Using a spatula to hold the apples back, pour apple juices into a saucepan (drain off what you can, you don't need every drop).","name":"Drain off juices: Remove trays from oven. Using a spatula to hold the apples back, pour apple juices into a saucepan (drain off what you can, you don't need every drop).","url":"https://www.recipetineats.com/apple-pie-recipe/#wprm-recipe-77185-step-2-4"},{"@type":"HowToStep","text":"Cool apple: Leave apple slices to cool on the tray, about 15 minutes.","name":"Cool apple: Leave apple slices to cool on the tray, about 15 minutes.","url":"https://www.recipetineats.com/apple-pie-recipe/#wprm-recipe-77185-step-2-5"},{"@type":"HowToStep","text":"Apple syrup: Add butter to apple juice saucepan and simmer on low heat until it reduces to 1/3 cup (80 ml), becoming syrupy. This might take 1 minute if you didn't start with much juices, or 3 - 5 minutes if you started with 1/2 cup or more juices. This might take 1 minute if you didn't start with much juices, or 3 - 5 minutes if you started with 1/2 cup or more juices. Remove from stove and let cool.","url":"https://www.recipetineats.com/apple-pie-recipe/#wprm-recipe-77185-step-2-6"}]},{"@type":"HowToSection","name":"Assemble and bake:","itemListElement":[{"@type":"HowToStep","text":"Turn oven up to 200°C/400°F (180°C fan).","name":"Turn oven up to 200°C/400°F (180°C fan).","url":"https://www.recipetineats.com/apple-pie-recipe/#wprm-recipe-77185-step-3-0"},{"@type":"HowToStep","text":"Fill: Use a spatula or egg flip to scoop up apple slices. Pour apple syrup over the slices and any residual juices from the baking trays.","url":"https://www.recipetineats.com/apple-pie-recipe/#wprm-recipe-77185-step-3-1"},{"@type":"HowToStep","text":"Pastry lattice or lid: Top with pastry lattice - see in post for my method. Brush lattice with egg wash (avoid the pie rim else it will over-brown there), ensuring you don't get pools of egg in the joins. Sprinkle with sugar.","name":"Pastry lattice or lid: Top with pastry lattice - see in post for my method. Trim excess, and press to adhere on to pie crust rim using water to seal. Brush lattice with egg wash (avoid the pie rim else it will over-brown there), ensuring you don't get pools of egg in the joins. Sprinkle with sugar.","url":"https://www.recipetineats.com/apple-pie-recipe/#wprm-recipe-77185-step-3-2"},{"@type":"HowToStep","text":"Bake 45 minutes or until the pastry is golden and you see the syrup bubbling through the lattice.","name":"Bake 45 minutes or until the pastry is golden and you see the syrup bubbling through the lattice.","url":"https://www.recipetineats.com/apple-pie-recipe/#wprm-recipe-77185-step-3-3"},{"@type":"HowToStep","text":"Serving fresh: Cool at least 3 hours before cutting to serve!","name":"Serving fresh: Cool at least 3 hours before cutting to serve!","url":"https://www.recipetineats.com/apple-pie-recipe/#wprm-recipe-77185-step-3-4"},{"@type":"HowToStep","text":"Option for neat slices: After cooling, refrigerate overnight. Turn pie out of pie dish (it's sturdy enough once cooled). Then you can cut neat slices. Place on a tray, cover with foil and reheat for 10 minutes in a 180°C/350°F oven (or microwave in emergency!).","url":"https://www.recipetineats.com/apple-pie-recipe/#wprm-recipe-77185-step-3-5"},{"@type":"HowToStep","text":"In either case serve with vanilla ice cream, always!","name":"In either case serve with vanilla ice cream, always!","url":"https://www.recipetineats.com/apple-pie-recipe/#wprm-recipe-77185-step-3-6"}]}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":"4.71","ratingCount":"24"},"recipeCategory":["Dessert","Pie"],"recipeCuisine":["Western"],"keywords":"apple pie","nutrition":{"@type":"NutritionInformation","calories":"474 kcal","carbohydrateContent":"79 g","proteinContent":"5 g","fatContent":"17 g","saturatedFatContent":"5 g","transFatContent":"0.02 g","cholesterolContent":"17 mg","sodiumContent":"432 mg","fiberContent":"6 g","sugarContent":"43 g","unsaturatedFatContent":"10 g","servingSize":"1 serving"},"@id":"https://www.recipetineats.com/apple-pie-recipe/#recipe","isPartOf":{"@id":"https://www.recipetineats.com/apple-pie-recipe/#article"},"mainEntityOfPage":"https://www.recipetineats.com/apple-pie-recipe/"}]}</script>

<p>The one trick with this apple pie recipe that makes all the difference? Baking the apple slices first. It’s the magic key to a crispy base, superior flavour and perfectly-cooked-and-never-mushy filling. It’s also how you get a generous amount of pie filling without the dreaded giant empty cavity under the lid.</p>



<p>Serve this all-time favourite warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream for the perfect homemade dessert!</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img decoding="async" width="900" height="1125" src="https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Apple-Pie_8.jpg" alt="Close up of a slice of Apple Pie" class="wp-image-77305" srcset="https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Apple-Pie_8.jpg 900w, https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Apple-Pie_8.jpg?resize=80,100 80w, https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Apple-Pie_8.jpg?resize=85,106 85w, https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Apple-Pie_8.jpg?resize=650,813 650w" sizes="(min-width: 768px) 650px, (max-width: 320px) 93.75vw, 97.39vw" data-pin-media="https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Apple-Pie_8.jpg"></figure>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading has-text-align-center" id="h-my-perfect-apple-pie">My perfect Apple Pie</h2>



<p>Of all the sweet pies out there, Apple Pie might just be the most iconic of them all. In America, it’s practically its own religion and talk about what exactly makes the perfect Apple Pie can get as prickly as politics.</p>



<p>Well, let me weigh in and tell you about <em>my</em> idea of the perfect Apple Pie. </p>



<p>My perfect pie is packed with a generous amount of apple filling that’s never mushy and never undercooked. There’s some spicing but it’s even-handed and doesn’t overwhelm. The filling is also not overly sweet and won’t leave you grasping for a glass of water.</p>



<p>Then the pastry. All this cosy apple goodness is encased in a shell of irresistibly flaky, buttery shortcrust. It’s not chewy nor is it sad and soggy. And let’s not forget the base! Of course it’s got to be perfectly crispy – no exceptions.</p>



<p>That’s my vision of perfect Apple Pie. If that all sounds good to you, then dare I say this might become <em>your</em> perfect apple pie recipe too. I hope you enjoy this recipe for many years to come!</p>



<p><em><strong>Recipe credits – </strong>Many thanks to my French pastry chef teacher <a href="https://jenniferpogmore.com" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Jennifer Pogmore</a> and RecipeTin’s <a href="https://www.recipetineats.com/chef-jean-baptiste-alexandre/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Chef JB</a> for their assistance and expertise to bring my vision of the perfect Apple Pie to life. We did it!!! </em></p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="900" height="720" src="https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Apple-Pie_9.jpg" alt="Close up cross section of apple pie" class="wp-image-77304" srcset="https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Apple-Pie_9.jpg 900w, https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Apple-Pie_9.jpg?resize=125,100 125w, https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Apple-Pie_9.jpg?resize=85,68 85w, https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Apple-Pie_9.jpg?resize=650,520 650w" sizes="(min-width: 768px) 650px, (max-width: 320px) 93.75vw, 97.39vw" data-pin-media="https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Apple-Pie_9.jpg"></figure>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="900" height="1260" src="https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Apple-Pie_6.jpg" alt="Overhead photo of apple pie whole" class="wp-image-77300" srcset="https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Apple-Pie_6.jpg 900w, https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Apple-Pie_6.jpg?resize=71,100 71w, https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Apple-Pie_6.jpg?resize=85,119 85w, https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Apple-Pie_6.jpg?resize=650,910 650w" sizes="(min-width: 768px) 650px, (max-width: 320px) 93.75vw, 97.39vw" data-pin-media="https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Apple-Pie_6.jpg"></figure>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading has-text-align-center" id="h-where-so-many-apple-pie-recipes-go-wrong">Where so many Apple Pie recipes go wrong</h2>



<p>I don’t normally write so bluntly. But this is a very long post so I don’t have time for measured politeness!</p>



<p>My recipe for perfect Apple Pie is really borne of all the things I have disliked about other Apple Pie recipes I have tried over the years, which I wanted to address. Here’s my biggest gripes:</p>



<ol>
<li><p><strong>Soggy base or crust not properly cooked </strong>– This one’s a common problem with recipes where the crust is not blind baked before filling with apples, or raw apples are baked inside the crust. Apple juices have to go somewhere, you know?? That somewhere is into your pastry. (And nope, thickening with cornflour/cornstarch won’t save the pie.)</p></li>



<li><p><strong>Mushy apples. Or it’s opposite, crunchy undercooked apples</strong> – I don’t know which is worse. Both are just a big fat <em>no!</em></p></li>



<li><p><strong>Overly sweet fillings and spice overkill</strong> – I want to taste the apples!</p></li>



<li><p><strong>Not much apple flavour</strong> – Some recipes even boil apples … ick. Just no.</p></li>



<li><p><strong>Skimpy amount of filling</strong> – Any recipe calling for less than 1.5kg / 3lb of apples will end up pretty scant on the filling. Pies are supposed to be all about generosity!</p></li>



<li><p><strong>A giant empty cavity under the lid </strong>– A recipe calling for raw apples to be piled high in the crust results in a bulging pastry cage for a lid. The lid smashes in when you cut it, creating a frightful (though admittedly still-delicious) mess!</p></li>
</ol>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="1200" height="610" src="https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Pie-made-with-raw-apples.jpg?w=900" alt="" class="wp-image-77117" srcset="https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Pie-made-with-raw-apples.jpg 1200w, https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Pie-made-with-raw-apples.jpg?resize=197,100 197w, https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Pie-made-with-raw-apples.jpg?resize=900,458 900w, https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Pie-made-with-raw-apples.jpg?resize=85,43 85w, https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Pie-made-with-raw-apples.jpg?resize=650,330 650w" sizes="(min-width: 768px) 650px, (max-width: 320px) 93.75vw, 97.39vw" data-pin-media="https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Pie-made-with-raw-apples.jpg?w=900"><figcaption class="wp-element-caption">Giant mound of raw apples cooks down, leaving an empty cavity under the pie lid. No!</figcaption></figure>



<p>Reading back over my list, you must think I’m a bit of a whiny, difficult-to-please person. 😂 It’s not that at all! People in my life know very well I am far from a hoity-toity type.</p>



<p>For me, the thing about Apple Pie is that it’s not a quick recipe especially when you take the time to make the crust from scratch. So the end result needs to be worth the effort, ie. flawless!</p>



<p>The other thing – and this is the clincher – is that pretty much all of the issues I listed above boil down to how the <em>filling</em> is dealt with. A filling made with raw apples for instance is a very common approach but leads to all sorts of problems like those I mentioned.</p>



<p>If we can just fix the filling, we’re laughing.</p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading has-text-align-center" id="h-the-solution-bake-the-apples">The solution: Bake the apples</h2>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="900" height="252" src="https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/3.-Baking-apples-1.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-77272" srcset="https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/3.-Baking-apples-1.jpg 900w, https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/3.-Baking-apples-1.jpg?resize=357,100 357w, https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/3.-Baking-apples-1.jpg?resize=85,24 85w, https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/3.-Baking-apples-1.jpg?resize=650,182 650w" sizes="(min-width: 768px) 650px, (max-width: 320px) 93.75vw, 97.39vw" data-pin-media="https://www.recipetineats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/3.-Baking-apples-1.jpg"><figcaption class="wp-element-caption">Baking apple slices prior to filling the pie ended up being the easy solution to issues I had with previous pie recipes. Bonus: better apple flavour!</figcaption></figure>



<p>The solution to my gripes turned out to be simple: Bake the apples. It’s as easy as that. </p>



<p>Here’s why it works:</p>



<ul>
<li><p>The apples cook evenly</p></li>



<li><p>The apple juices can be reduced to a syrup so it’s not runny and doesn’t soak the base</p></li>



<li><p>The apples are cooked down first so you don’t end up with a giant empty pie-lid cavity </p></li>



<li><p>It’s far easier than stovetop-cooking your apples. Stirring a tonne of apple slices is not fun, plus they don’t really cook evenly.</p></li>



<li><p>And … <em>better flavour!</em></p></li>
</ul>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading">Here’s the proof!</h2>



<p>And here’s photo evidence of the difference baking the apples makes:</p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading">Exhibit A: Crispy base</h3>



<p>Here are a couple of photos to show you the crispy base.</p>
